column1: Porphobilinogen (PBG) is one of several types of porphyrins found in your body.
One of these is hemoglobin, the protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen in the blood.
If this process does not occur, porphyrins such as PBG can build up in your body.
Your provider may tell you to temporarily stop taking medicines that may affect the test results.
This test may be done if your provider suspects porphyria or another disorder associated with an abnormal PBG level.
